Description: Fragment of a large bivalve mollusc shell. Conical shape with smoothed surfaces. Inscription engraved on the internal surface.
Curator's comments: This shell was dedicated as an ex-voto to the god Apollo. Several engraved shells were discovered in Naukratis, especially belonging to the class of Tricdana squamosa (BM 1886,0401.1594, BM 1886,0401.1596-1597), but also mother-of-pearl (BM 1886,0401.1595). This piece might be the "long cone shell, smoothed" that Petrie mentioned, though he specified that it was "not yet engraved" (Petrie 1886, 36). Petrie, W.M.F. 1886, Naukratis. Part I., 1884–5 (third memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London, 35-36, Pl. XX, 10-12, 16.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (WA.12)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.49)
